{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3492384,"name":"John Bottenberg","username":"John_Bottenberg","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/john_bottenberg/{size}/224569_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-25T16:34:05.623Z","cooked":"

If my team mounts the RoboRIO underneath a brushless motor like this:

PXL_20250125_154814343.MP1920×3413 448 KB

Should we be concerned about the RoboRIO’s proximity to the motor? Is there any chance that electromagnetic interference from the motor will mess with the operation of the electronics? Specifically, I’m wondering about the IMU in the NavX as well as the analog input pins on the RoboRIO, since we will be using the Thrifty mag encoders for sensing swerve module angle, and thus will need high analog input accuracy.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2025-01-25T16:39:11.547Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":14,"reads":90,"readers_count":89,"score":88.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":483547,"topic_slug":"are-the-roborio-and-or-navx-susceptible-to-electromagnetic-interference-from-motors","display_username":"John Bottenberg","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":12266,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3142, 8706, 714←4973←2930←3322←67"},"post_url":"/t/are-the-roborio-and-or-navx-susceptible-to-electromagnetic-interference-from-motors/483547/1","custom_user_title":"3142, 8706, 714←4973←2930←3322←67","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3492431,"name":"Pedro Braga","username":"predobrega","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/predobrega/{size}/211207_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-25T17:10:50.669Z","cooked":"

I know from having our imu too close to a NEO once that they have pretty much no magnetic shielding and will absolutely screw up the readings from any magnetometer this close to it.

The Rio might not be affected, since it only has an accelerometer, but the NavX has a magnetometer and will not be happy with this.

Is the magnetometer used in typical NavX operation, or is it something that we have to opt into?

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2025-01-25T18:00:56.026Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":65,"readers_count":64,"score":13.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":483547,"topic_slug":"are-the-roborio-and-or-navx-susceptible-to-electromagnetic-interference-from-motors","display_username":"John Bottenberg","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":63359,"username":"predobrega","name":"Pedro Braga","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/predobrega/{size}/211207_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":12266,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3142, 8706, 714←4973←2930←3322←67"},"post_url":"/t/are-the-roborio-and-or-navx-susceptible-to-electromagnetic-interference-from-motors/483547/3","custom_user_title":"3142, 8706, 714←4973←2930←3322←67","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3492698,"name":"Pedro Braga","username":"predobrega","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/predobrega/{size}/211207_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-25T22:54:00.028Z","cooked":"

Looking at the NavX documentation, it seems like you have to calibrate the magnetometer before it gives you the fused mag+gyro value. So, it’s all ok I guess?
Still, if possible, would advise you to give it a little more room.
If you want to be certain it’s not going to affect anything, I suppose you could test it by reading known yaw values with the motor on, and seeing if they are within an acceptable margin of error.
